title: PermissionFile
description: Permission file that can define a default permission, a set of permissions or a list of inlined permissions.

default.description: The default permission set for the plugin

set.description: A list of permissions sets defined

DefaultPermission.description:
The default permission set of the plugin.

Works similarly to a permission with the "default" identifier.

description.description: Human-readable description of what the permission does.

PermissionSet.description: A set of direct permissions grouped together under a new name.

identifier.description: A unique identifier for the permission.

description.description: Human-readable description of what the permission does.

Permission.description:
Descriptions of explicit privileges of commands.

It can enable commands to be accessible in the frontend of the application.

If the scope is defined it can be used to fine grain control the access of individual or multiple commands.

identifier.description: A unique identifier for the permission.

description.description: Human-readable description of what the permission does.

commands.description: Allowed or denied commands when using this permission.

scope.description: Allowed or denied scoped when using this permission.

platforms.description: Target platforms this permission applies. By default all platforms are affected by this permission.

Commands.description:
Allowed and denied commands inside a permission.

If two commands clash inside of `allow` and `deny`, it should be denied by default.

Scopes.description:
A restriction of the command/endpoint functionality.

It can be of any serde serializable type and is used for allowing or preventing certain actions inside a Tauri command.

The scope is passed to the command and handled/enforced by the command itself.

allow.description: Data that defines what is allowed by the scope.

deny.description: Data that defines what is denied by the scope.

anyOf.description: Represents a map of [`String`] keys to [`Value`]s.

oneOf.description: MacOS.
Windows.
Linux.
Android.
iOS.
allow-all -> This enables all permissions for Jarvis
